thread.title: Rupee falls 9 paise against dollar, reaches 18.11 vs dirham
thread.title_full: Rupee falls 9 paise against dollar, reaches 18.11 vs dirham

title: Rupee falls 9 paise against dollar, reaches 18.11 vs dirham
text: Rupee falls 9 paise against dollar, reaches 18.11 vs dirham PTI Filed on February 28, 2017 | Last updated on February 28, 2017 at 08.50 am Share Vote After a 3.4 month high yesterday, the rupee slipped against the US dollar. The rupee drifted lower by 9 paise to 66.80 against the US dollar (18.11 against UAE dirham) in early trade at the Interbank Foreign Exchange today after the American currency gained strength overseas. Forex dealers said that month-end demand for the greenback from importers and gains against other currencies overseas as investors keenly await US President Donald Trump's speech at a joint session of Congress today, put pressure on the rupee. They said, however, a higher opening of the domestic equity market capped the rupee's losses. Yesterday, the rupee had strengthened to close at a fresh three-and-a-half month high of 66.71, appreciating by 11 paise on the back of sustained selling of the American dollar by exporters and banks. Meanwhile, the benchmark BSE Sensex went up by 50.53 points, or 0.18 per cent, to 28,863.41 in the opening trade today. Share
